result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Sha Rhonda S Ford in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Sha Rhonda S Ford.  Attorney Andrea M Will in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Michelle Trussoni, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Sonderhouse.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/20/2022 requesting a bail modification hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/25/2022 - A bail hearing will be scheduled once the defendant has had counsel appointed through the public defender's office.**
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 19th, 2022.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sha Rhonda S Ford
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 4521 Harvest Ln, Sachse, TX 75048

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Extended Stay/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. If the defendant has a passport she is to surrender her passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

3:21 PM Defendant Sha Rhonda S Ford in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Sha Rhonda S Ford.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
